#Text=Sharm el-Sheikh

#Text=Sharm el-Sheikh ( Arabic : شرم الشيخ , also transliterated as Sharm ash Shaykh and popularly known simply as " Sharm " ) is a well-known port and resort town at the southern tip of the Sinai Peninsula in Egypt , popular with package holiday makers and divers .
#Text=Understand
#Text=Sharm el-Sheikh is one of the most popular tourist destinations in the Arab world .
#Text=But there are also some very good reasons to visit it if you are not the common tourist , who likes to lie on the beach all day .
#Text=It is one of the finest diving spots in the world and a trip into the desert is an unforgettable adventure .
#Text=The Sinai Peninsula is a remote desert mountain range .
#Text=The rocky mountains are parted from the deep-blue sea by a flat desert strip .
#Text=This combination of desert and sea is an incredible sight and makes you believe you are on a different planet .
#Text=Sharm el-Sheikh used to be nothing but a small fishing village with about 100 Bedouin citizens .
#Text=When Sinai was occupied by Israel in 1967 , Sharm el-Sheikh started to develop as a tourist destination ( like the rest of the peninsula ) .
#Text=The Israelis evacuated Sinai between 1979 and 1982 following the signing of a peace agreement between the two countries .
#Text=Since the 1980s , the Egyptians have been continuing the development of Sharm where the Israelis left off .
#Text=Sharm 's 100 grew into a bustling 10,000 population .
#Text=There is now a nice promenade , a Hard Rock Cafe , one of the most modern hospitals in Egypt and so on .
#Text=Climate
#Text=The climate is very dry .
#Text=Rainfall is very rare .
#Text=The weather is very hot in summer days and moderately hot at summer nights .
#Text=In winter , it is warm at days and has one of the warmest night temperatures in Egypt .
#Text=The most comfortable time to visit Sharm El-Sheikh are late summer and beginning of the fall .
#Text=For example in September the air temperature is about 34 ° C and water is about 29 ° C.
#Text=Orientation
#Text=The Na'ama Bay part of the city is the center of nightlife and dining : most of Sharm 's clubs , cafes , restaurants and shops are here .
#Text=Na'ama Bay lies midway between Sharm Airport and Old City , nearly 10 minutes driving from each .
#Text=Microbuses can take you from downtown , but to reach Na’ama Bay from the airport , you will have to take a cab .
#Text=Sharm el Sheikh has grown into three distinct areas now , Nabq is a new area to the north of Na'ama , Old Market and Hadaba to the south of Na'amaa Bay .
#Text=Get in
#Text=See Sinai for information on the Sinai visit pass , which allows visa-free travel for up to 14 days .
#Text=By plane
#Text=Sharm el-Sheikh Airport ( SSH ) .
#Text=The largest airport in the Sinai , it receives plane-loads of charter tourists daily in the winter high season .
#Text=The principal airline for local flights is EgyptAir .
#Text=There are 2 terminals that are next to each other .
#Text=Terminal 1 is the new one with Egypt Air and Easy Jet .
#Text=You will need a visa only if you plan to go out of the Sharm area ( such as Ras Mohammed bus or boat , Cairo , St Catherine 's ) .
#Text=It can be bought on arrival ( price seems to vary day to day , make sure you have £15 , US$ 15 , or € 15 handy .
#Text=For departures : timetable shows only nearest 1-2 hours , makes you watch over the row of check-in desks for your flight number .
#Text=Airport cafes

#Text=Cafes after security check are : Sbarro ( overcrowded ) , Cafe Europa ( on the back of the lounge , less crowded ) : sandwiches , coffee , Egyptian sweets ; outlet of Caffè Ritazza international chain coming soon ( also in Athens , Budapest , Madrid , Milan , London , Paris , New York , Stockholm , Zurich , Vienna ) .
#Text=Shops in the airport
#Text=After security check : Patisserie offers lucums , khalva and other Egyptian sweets .
#Text=By boat
#Text=Ferry services between Hurghada on the mainland Red Sea Coast and Sharm were suspended in 2018 .
#Text=The high-speed catamarans used to be run by La Pespes .
#Text=is along the southern entry road , about 1 km southeast of the old market .
#Text=By car or bus
#Text=Sharm el-Sheikh can be reached by driving down the eastern coast from Eilat ( Israel ) via Nuweiba and Dahab , or via the western coast from Cairo .
#Text=There are daily buses for both routes .
#Text=From Cairo , East Delta buses take approximately 8 hr ( LE80 ) while Superjet buses take 6 hr .
#Text=When taking the bus from Cairo , keep your bus ticket and passport handy , as you will pass through a number of checkpoints , which require passengers to present identification and ticket .
#Text=The drive is interesting with beautiful scenery , throughout the route .
#Text=is removed , by about a kilometer , from the Peace road .
#Text=If you should arrive during the evening hours your only option may be to take a taxi , as micro-bus service can be spotty .
#Text=Since Sharm is a tourist-driven economy , you should be prepared to do some bargaining .
#Text=If you are of the hiking type , the main road is , roughly , 20 minutes from main road .
#Text=Just ask anyone to point you in the direction of Peace road .
#Text=Once at Peace road you should have no problem hailing down a micro-bus .
#Text=When heading to the bus station via micro-bus along Peace Road , tell the driver that you are going to the bus station , and want to be left off at the gas station .
#Text=This may take some work , given the limited English skills of the drivers .
#Text=Once at the gas station , you should see micro-buses , which will take you on the final leg .
#Text=Remember , transfers are not issued , you must pay another fee for the final leg .
#Text=About micro-bus fees
#Text=If your journey is within a kilometer or two , the cost should be about ( LE3-5 ) .
#Text=If your stop is further out , or if you are traveling during the late night hours , be prepared to get a demand for more money , in some cases drivers may demand up to ( LE10-20 ) .
#Text=Demands for higher fees can also take place , if the driver feels he you have money !
#Text=So , be prepared to negotiate .
#Text=If the driver 's fee is unreasonable , get out — this will often bring down the cost .
#Text=When arriving , ask a local how much the bus costs before hailing one down .
#Text=The information provided will give you a base-line price , from which you can bargain with .
